summary: An issue has been discovered in GitLab affecting versions 17.0 prior to 17.0.2, 16.11 prior to 16.11.4, and 16.10 prior to 16.10.6. A Maintainer was able to abuse a path traversal to read arbitrary files on the server.
details: An issue has been discovered in GitLab affecting versions 17.0 prior to 17.0.2, 16.11 prior to 16.11.4, and 16.10 prior to 16.10.6. A Maintainer was able to abuse a path traversal to read arbitrary files on the server.

summary: An issue has been discovered in GitLab affecting versions 16.8 prior to 16.11.4 and 17.0 prior to 17.0.2. It was possible for a user to view the Dependency List of a private project in a public group.
details: An issue has been discovered in GitLab affecting versions 16.8 prior to 16.11.4 and 17.0 prior to 17.0.2. It was possible for a user to view the Dependency List of a private project in a public group.

summary: An issue has been discovered in GitLab affecting versions 14.6 prior to 16.11.4 and 17.0 prior to 17.0.2. It was possible for a user to access the CI/CD variables of other projects within the same public group.
details: An issue has been discovered in GitLab affecting versions 14.6 prior to 16.11.4 and 17.0 prior to 17.0.2. It was possible for a user to access the CI/CD variables of other projects within the same public group.

summary: An issue has been discovered in GitLab affecting versions 16.7 prior to 16.11.4 and 17.0 prior to 17.0.2. A remote code execution vulnerability was discovered in GitLab's CI/CD component. An attacker could exploit this by tricking a user into running a malicious CI/CD job.
details: An issue has been discovered in GitLab affecting versions 16.7 prior to 16.11.4 and 17.0 prior to 17.0.2. A remote code execution vulnerability was discovered in GitLab's CI/CD component. An attacker could exploit this by tricking a user into running a malicious CI/CD job.

summary: An issue has been discovered in GitLab affecting versions 16.7 prior to 16.11.3 and 17.0 prior to 17.0.1. It was possible for a user to bypass CODEOWNERS approval by creating a merge request from a fork.
details: An issue has been discovered in GitLab affecting versions 16.7 prior to 16.11.3 and 17.0 prior to 17.0.1. It was possible for a user to bypass CODEOWNERS approval by creating a merge request from a fork.
